request_templates.name: Colorado Standard CORA Request
request_templates.description: General purpose records request for Colorado state agencies
request_templates.template_text:
Dear Records Custodian:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, C.R.S. §§ 24-72-200.1 through 24-72-205, I respectfully request access to and copies of the following public records:

[DESCRIBE RECORDS WITH SUFFICIENT SPECIFICITY TO ENABLE CUSTODIAN TO LOCATE THE REQUESTED RECORD]

Per C.R.S. § 24-72-203(3), please provide the requested records or deny this request in writing within three (3) working days after receipt of this application. If extenuating circumstances exist, you may extend this period for up to seven (7) additional working days by providing written notice of the extension and the reasons for it.

I prefer to receive these records in [SPECIFY FORMAT: electronic/paper]. If the records are maintained in electronic form, please provide them electronically when technologically practicable per C.R.S. § 24-72-203(7).

I understand that per C.R.S. § 24-72-203(6), no research and retrieval fee will be charged for the first hour of staff time, but reasonable fees may apply for additional time required.

If you determine that some portions of these records are exempt from disclosure under C.R.S. § 24-72-204, please provide the non-exempt portions and cite the specific statutory exemption for any withholdings.

If you deny any portion of this request, please provide written statement of the grounds for denial with specific statutory citation as required by C.R.S. § 24-72-203(5)(a).

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Sincerely,
[REQUESTER NAME]
[ADDRESS]
[CITY, STATE ZIP]
[PHONE NUMBER]
[EMAIL ADDRESS]
[DATE]

request_templates.name: Colorado CORA Reconsideration Request
request_templates.description: Template for requesting reconsideration of denied CORA request
request_templates.template_text:
Dear Records Custodian:

Pursuant to C.R.S. § 24-72-203(5)(b), I respectfully request reconsideration of your denial of my Colorado Open Records Act request dated [REQUEST DATE] and denied on [DENIAL DATE].

My original request sought the following records:
[DESCRIBE ORIGINAL REQUEST]

Your denial cited [SPECIFIC EXEMPTION CLAIMED]. I believe this denial is improper for the following reasons:

1. [EXPLAIN WHY EXEMPTION DOESN'T APPLY]
2. [CITE RELEVANT CORA PROVISIONS]
3. [REFERENCE COLORADO'S POLICY FAVORING DISCLOSURE]

The Colorado Open Records Act declares it to be public policy that "all public records shall be open for inspection by any person at reasonable times" per C.R.S. § 24-72-200.1. Exemptions should be narrowly construed to effectuate this policy.

I offer to meet and confer with you to discuss the scope and basis of this request as contemplated by the statute.

I request that you:
1. Reverse your denial decision
2. Provide the requested records or non-exempt portions
3. If you maintain partial denial, provide detailed explanation with specific statutory citations

If this reconsideration is unsuccessful, please be advised that I may seek judicial review in district court after the 14-day period specified in C.R.S. § 24-72-205(1).

I prefer to resolve this matter cooperatively rather than through litigation.

Thank you for your reconsideration.

Sincerely,
[REQUESTER NAME]
[ADDRESS]
[CITY, STATE ZIP]
[PHONE NUMBER]
[EMAIL ADDRESS]
[DATE]

Enclosures: Copy of original request and denial letter

request_templates.name: Colorado District Court CORA Application
request_templates.description: Template for district court application to compel records disclosure
request_templates.template_text:
IN THE DISTRICT COURT IN AND FOR [COUNTY] COUNTY, COLORADO

[APPLICANT NAME],           )
  Applicant,               )
                          )
  v.                      )  Case No. ____________
                          )
[CUSTODIAN/AGENCY NAME],   )
  Respondent.             )

APPLICATION FOR ORDER DIRECTING CUSTODIAN TO SHOW CAUSE
PURSUANT TO COLORADO OPEN RECORDS ACT

TO THE HONORABLE COURT:

Applicant brings this action under C.R.S. § 24-72-205 to compel disclosure of public records improperly withheld under the Colorado Open Records Act.

1. JURISDICTION AND VENUE
This Court has jurisdiction under C.R.S. § 24-72-205. Venue is proper as the records are found in [COUNTY] County, Colorado.

2. PARTIES
Applicant is a person entitled to inspect public records under CORA.

Respondent [CUSTODIAN/AGENCY] is the custodian of the requested records.

3. FACTUAL BACKGROUND
On [DATE], Applicant submitted a CORA request seeking [DESCRIBE RECORDS].

[On [DATE], Applicant filed a request for reconsideration with Respondent.]

Respondent denied the request [and reconsideration] on [DATE], claiming exemption under [CITE CLAIMED EXEMPTION].

More than fourteen days have passed since [the reconsideration request was received/denial of reconsideration].

4. GROUNDS FOR RELIEF
Respondent's denial violates CORA because:
a) [EXPLAIN WHY RECORDS ARE PUBLIC]
b) [EXPLAIN WHY CLAIMED EXEMPTION DOESN'T APPLY]
c) [CITE COLORADO POLICY FAVORING DISCLOSURE]

5. REQUEST FOR RELIEF
WHEREFORE, Applicant respectfully requests:
a) Order directing Respondent to show cause why inspection should not be permitted;
b) Order compelling disclosure of the requested records;
c) Award of court costs and attorney fees per C.R.S. § 24-72-205(3) if Respondent's action was arbitrary or capricious;
d) Other relief deemed just and proper.

Respectfully submitted,

_________________________
[ATTORNEY NAME AND NUMBER]
[OR APPLICANT SIGNATURE IF PRO SE]
[ADDRESS]
[CITY, STATE ZIP]
[PHONE]
[EMAIL]
Attorney for Applicant [OR "Pro Se"]

VERIFICATION
[Include verification that facts are true and correct]
